title: Never Have Warm Beer Again With This Table That Packs A Fridge
text:
Extremely Cool Coffee Table Features A Fridge, Speakers And More Â© Sobro / Indiegogo Extremely Cool Coffee Table Features A Fridge, Speakers And More Trending News: Never Have Warm Beer Again With This Table That Packs A Fridge 
This coffee table + fridge combo is a must have for any bachelor pad. Long Story 
So, how's March Madness going? Was it fun getting up to grab a beer from the fridge only to miss the big bucket? How about that moment when your phone died 'cause you were checking your bracket every five minutes (in disbelief)? Yeah, crappy, huh? Well, that's because you've been using a coffee table from the stone age rather than living in 2017. 
But don't worry, this coffee table will take your home theater to another level. It's got a beer fridge to keep your tall boys nice and chilly. It's got a Bluetooth speaker you can hook up to the TV, or bump some tunes while you watch. It's also got LED lights, charging ports and touch control so you can feel like you're punching in codes on a ship from Star Trek. 
But I'm not beyond criticism. One, WTF is with the name? Are they seriously calling it Sobro? That's SO BRO. 
Second, is it really bringing you stuff you don't already have access to? You could easily buy a cheap beer fridge to plunk beside the couch. And charging ports can't be too far when you're in a living room. What does that leave? Speakers? You're sitting in front of a home theater, how many speakers could you possibly need? 
But then again, it's a wonder in its oversimplicity. As a matter of fact, it might be the most American thing ever. Pioneers to the United States had bread and meat, but it took the American way of thinking to create the hamburger. Combos are key folks. 
So yes, you might have all those features nearby, but do you have them all in one coffee table? No, you don't, not unless you've got a Sobro, bro. 
If you want one, it's available on Indiegogo and right now it's still offering an early bird price of $499 + shipping.   
How have we been watching sports Drop This Fact
